messages.content: ComfyUI-yaResolutionSelector is a custom node in ComfyUI that allows users to freely adjust the resolution and aspect ratio of images while maintaining the pixel count of the StableDiffusion model.

ComfyUI-yaResolutionSelector can be installed by downloading the zip file from the repository and unpacking it in the ComfyUI 'custom_nodes' directory or by cloning the repository in the 'custom_nodes' directory using the command 'git clone https://github.com/Tropfchen/ComfyUI-yaResolutionSelector.git'.
To uninstall ComfyUI-yaResolutionSelector, delete the 'ComfyUI-yaResolutionSelector' folder in the ComfyUI 'custom_nodes' directory.
How can the yaResolution Selector be used in ComfyUI?
To use yaResolution Selector in ComfyUI, right-click on 'Empty Latent Image' and choose one of the 'Prepend yaResolution Selector' options. The new nodes can also be found in the 'utils' menu.
What is the 'constant_resolution' option in the yaResolution Selector (Advanced) node?

The 'constant_resolution' option in the yaResolution Selector (Advanced) node attempts to output dimensions with the same pixel count as a 1:1 image generated with the base resolution. This outputs resolutions similar to those recommended for use with SDXL.
How can new aspect ratio presets be added to the yaResolution Selector node?
New aspect ratio presets can be added to the yaResolution Selector node by modifying the 'ratios.txt' file. The values should always be included in the format 'width:height'.
What is the purpose of the 'overextend' option in the yaResolution Selector (Advanced) node?

The 'overextend' option in the yaResolution Selector (Advanced) node allows the output resolution to be larger than the base resolution while maintaining the aspect ratio. This is useful when using models that can still generate good images at resolutions larger than the base resolution.
